reviews.text: The hotel is wonderfully positioned right on the beach. The beach is huge and stretches for miles and is shallow enough for the first 100 metres or so that we could let our 6 and 4 year old wander off into the sea for a splash around without any concerns. We stayed in a one bedroom suite in the hotel - excellent value for money - view of the sea, balcony and two TVs - especially handy during the World Cup. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly at all times. Short walk into town where there were many restaurants and bars. Located next to playground also and a very short walk to the Tervise Paradis hotel and indoor waterpark.
reviews.title: Fabulous location
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: Altogether an excellent hotel in a lovely town.

The Scandic Ranna Hotel is one of the nicest hotel’s I have ever stayed in. Its location is excellent, surrounded by beautiful gardens and right by what must rank as one of the loveliest beaches anywhere, combined with excellent staff who cannot do enough for you. Free internet for all the guests, delicious buffet breakfasts which we ate on the veranda overlooking the beach, and sparkling clean Scandinavian furnished rooms. All the rooms have a sea view.
reviews.title: what a location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ranna Hotel for two nights and were given a sea view
reviews.title: Very Nice Art Deco Hotel
Loved the Ranna Hotel!
reviews.text: room on the second floor. While the room is quite small and the bathroom a bit behind the times, we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Aside from the small nature of the room, the only downside I could see it having was no air conditioning. The balcony was a great place to relax and provided enough cool air though. The staff was excellent as well as the choices in the breakfast buffet. Unsecured internet wireless worked well. The roof top bar was a great place to relax at night and drinks very reasonable. We also had dinner in the hotel. It was quite delicious and the wait staff was very attentive.

One of our party used the hotel's laundry service and we were surprised to see how cheap the prices were. The hotel is located within walking distance of the old town and, of course, across from the beach. The only downer to our stay was being awaken at 6 am with loud 50s music being played from the hotel's outside patio loudspeaker. All in all, this is a great hotel and lets you see how/experience hotels were in the prewar days.
reviews.title: not really that good

reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel with terrific views! We enjoyed 5 days at the beach- the location couldn’t have been any more prefect - you're right on the long sandy beach and it’s only a 15 minutes walk into the center of Parnu.
reviews.title: A true blue waterfront icon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is correctly described as an art deco icon. I’m referring here to other reviews that give you a good impression of the place. The renovation was done tastefully and with the original design in mind.
reviews.title: Heavenly! - an Art Deco paradise!
